chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaqaun Ld Beeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 124 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Cases 22TR4138 and 22TR4137 were dismissed and read in. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
11:25 AM Defendant Jaqaun Ld Beeman in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Jaqaun Ld Beeman.  Attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Count 2. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 22TR4137 and 22TR4138. 

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4.5 YEARS
Initial Confinement: 18 MONTHS
Extended Supervision: 3 YEARS
124   Days Credit.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
 No Use or Possession of  controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $ 268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
